conflictDescription: User Story A requires monitoring patient health data without consent (operation O), while User Story B implies manually controlling and restricting data logging and display to protect privacy, effectively forbidding unrestricted data monitoring. These requirements contradict as one mandates data access without consent, and the other forbids such unrestricted data sharing.
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff, I want to monitor patient health data without requiring their consent, so that I can prioritize care efficiently.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to manually choose what client data is logged and shown, ensuring each client's privacy and preventing overload.
cluster: Strict Privacy Control over Data Sharing
resolutionDescription: Adjusted User Story A to require monitoring patient health data only with consent under critical conditions, while User Story B maintains manual control over data logging and display to ensure privacy, thus reconciling monitoring needs with privacy protection.
newUserStoryASummary: As medical staff, I want to monitor patient health data with consent during critical situations, so that care can be prioritized efficiently.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually control which client data is logged and displayed, ensuring privacy and preventing overload.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires monitoring patient health data without consent, mandating data collection, while User Story B forbids automatic health data logging, requiring manual control to respect privacy. These impose mutually exclusive constraints on data logging operation.
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff, I want to monitor patient health data without requiring their consent, so that I can prioritize care efficiently.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to disable automatic health data logging and manually select what is recorded to fully respect my clients' privacy preferences.
cluster: Strict Privacy Control over Data Sharing
resolutionDescription: Clarify priorities and respect privacy by requiring health data monitoring only with consent and allowing manual control when consent is absent, balancing care efficiency and privacy.
newUserStoryASummary: As medical staff, I want to monitor patient health data with consent, so I can prioritize care efficiently.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to disable automatic health data logging and manually select recordings to respect privacy.

userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to disable automatic logging and manually select what data is recorded and shared to fully respect each client's privacy preferences while always receiving all notifications.

newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to control data logging manually to respect privacy while ensuring critical notifications are received.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires monitoring patient health data without consent, while User Story B emphasizes discreet social event suggestions to avoid breaching privacy, implying a strong privacy constraint. This creates a conflict where one story mandates an operation (data monitoring without consent) that another implicitly forbids due to privacy concerns.
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff, I want to monitor patient health data without requiring their consent, so that I can prioritize care efficiently.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want ALFRED to suggest local social events discreetly, so I can support participation without overwhelming or breaching the older adult’s privacy.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires blocking all non-emergency notifications during work hours (forbid operation), while User Story B requires always receiving all notifications regardless of conditions (start operation). These opposing instructions on notification delivery conflict under the same event of notification handling.
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff, I want to block all non-emergency notifications during work hours, so that I can avoid distractions and focus on urgent patient care.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to disable automatic logging and manually select what data is recorded and shared to fully respect each client's privacy preferences while always receiving all notifications.

newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to disable automatic logging and manually select what data is recorded and shared to fully respect each client's privacy preferences while always receiving all notifications.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires ALFRED to support only clinical caregiving actions without emotional considerations (implying forbidding emotional engagement), while User Story B requires ALFRED to send all notifications including non-critical and encourage emotional engagement, which are opposing instructions for the system's behavior on notifications and interaction style.
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff member, I want ALFRED to support only clinical caregiving actions without considering patients' emotional states, so I can provide efficient and professional care.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want ALFRED to send all notifications, including non-critical ones, and encourage emotional engagement, so I can stay responsive and support personalized care.
cluster: Strict Voice Activation and Privacy Control
resolutionDescription: Apply a contextual policy layer to allow ALFRED to support clinical caregiving actions focused on efficiency while enabling emotional engagement and notifications only in non-critical or user-appropriate contexts.
newUserStoryASummary: As a medical staff member, I want ALFRED to support efficient clinical caregiving actions without emotional distractions, so I can provide professional care.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want ALFRED to send notifications and encourage emotional engagement selectively, so I can support personalized care appropriately.
